properties.name: strategy
properties.description: Strategy which defines basic framework settings

properties.name: driver
properties.description: Driver name used to run tests

properties.name: driver.version
properties.description: Version of the web driver

properties.name: drivers.folder
properties.description: Absolute or relative path to the local driver folder

properties.name: timeout.wait.element
properties.description: Timeout in seconds to wait for an element on the opened page

properties.name: timeout.wait.page
properties.description: Timeout in seconds to wait for a newly opened page to load

properties.name: domain
properties.description: Web application domain URL (in case of testing single application)

properties.name: screens.folder
properties.description: Absolute or relative path to folder with screenshots

properties.name: list.start.index
properties.description: Index of initial element in WebList.

properties.name: log.info.details
properties.description: Specify additional info that should be logged for each action

properties.name: screenshot.strategy
properties.description: Specify situation while JDI make screenshot

properties.name: html.code.strategy
properties.description: A strategy for writing html-code of the web element last processed before test failure to log.

properties.name: requests.strategy
properties.description: When to log requests 4ХХ, 5ХХ errors

properties.name: browser.kill
properties.description: Specify when all test browser instances should be shut down [after/before test execution]

properties.name: element.search.strategy
properties.description: Specify element's searching strategy

properties.name: browser.size
properties.description: The size of the browser by default

properties.name: page.load.strategy
properties.description: Similarly to Selenium, strategies to load the page

properties.name: page.check.after.open
properties.description: Specify should JDI check page url and title while it opens by default

properties.name: assert.type
properties.description: Default assertion's type: strict or soft

properties.name: click.type
properties.description: Specify how JDI will perform click

properties.name: text.type
properties.description: Specify how JDI will perform getText()

properties.name: set.text.type
properties.description: The way of setting text to the element.

properties.name: remote.type
properties.description: TSpecify remote run type: sauce labs, browserstack, selenium grid

properties.name: driver.remote.url
properties.description: Specify URL that will be used to run tests remotely

properties.name: log.level
properties.description: Specify log level

properties.name: allure.steps
properties.description: Log steps in Allure

properties.name: smart.locator
properties.description: Specify template for Smart locator

properties.name: smart.locator.to.name
properties.description: Specify how element variable will be transformed to smart locator variable that will be placed instead of %s

properties.name: smart.search
properties.description: When to use smart locators.

properties.name: headless
properties.description: Whether to use headless browser or not.

properties.name: chrome.capabilities.path
properties.description: Specify path/filename to chrome properties (relative from src/java/resources)

properties.name: ff.capabilities.path
properties.description: Specify path/filename to firefox properties (relative from src/java/resources)

properties.name: ie.capabilities.path
properties.description: Specify path/filename to internet explorer properties (relative from src/java/resources)

properties.name: edge.capabilities.path
properties.description: Specify path/filename to edge internet explorer properties (relative from src/java/resources)

properties.name: opera.capabilities.path
properties.description: Specify path/filename to opera properties (relative from src/java/resources)

properties.name: safari.capabilities.path
properties.description: Specify path/filename to safari properties (relative from src/java/resources)

properties.name: common.capabilities.path
properties.description: Specify path/filename to common properties that will be applied for all browsers (relative from src/java/resources)

values.description: Use Selenium like click in the Center of the element; Support Smart locators and elements cache; Smart Get text (try to get text from text, value and inner text of the element); Text Field input clear field before do sendKeys; Element considered as found if only one element found and it is visible

Use Smart click that try to find area to click on the element; scroll browser window to element before search; Support Smart locators and elements cache; Smart Get text (try to get text from text, value and inner text of the element); Text Field input as set value in to the "value" attribute; Element considered as found if only one element found and it is visible

Use Selenium like click in the Center of the element; Get element using simple findElement (no smart locators support); Get text using Selenium getText() method; Text Field input using Selenium sendKeys(...) method; Element considered as found if on the page no matter visible or not and if more then one element found than use first one
Always use latest driver version
Always use previous to latest driver version
Use exact driver version
WebDriver for Chrome browser
WebDriver for Firefox browser
WebDriver for Internet Explorer
WebDriver for Internet Explorer Edge browser
WebDriver for Opera browser
WebDriver for Safari browser
User should specify the place where screenshot should be done
Make a screenshot of the page in case of test failure (highlight last used element and place screenshot in the log and report)
Make a screenshot of the page for each JDI assertion
Do screenshot on each new opened page
Do not write html-code of the web element to log
Attach html-code of the page in case of test failure
Attach html-code of the page for each JDI assertion
Attach html-code of the page on each new opened page
No html requests will be added by default
Log requests 4ХХ, 5ХХ errors on the test failure
Log requests 4ХХ, 5ХХ errors on each JDI assert
Log requests 4ХХ, 5ХХ errors on each new opened page
Shut down the browser after and before test execution
Shut down the browser only after test execution
Shut down the browser only before test execution
[visible, single] Element considered as found if only one element found and it is visible
[any, multiple] Element considered as found if on the page no matter visible or not and if more then one element found than use first one
Element considered as found if on the page no matter visible or not
Element considered as found if it is visible
Element considered as found if only one element found
If  more than one element found then use first one
Browser window will be maximized
Browser window will be set to 1024x762 resolution
No additional info. Log only test scenario
Log element name
Log full element's locator (with context)
Log PageObject, element variable name and full locator
Indicates WebDriver should wait for the document readiness state to be "complete" after navigation
Indicates WebDriver should not wait on the document readiness state after a navigation event
Indicates WebDriver should wait for the document readiness state to become "interactive" after navigation
Do not check the page has been opened
Execute checkOpened() for each new page in order to check that correct page opened
Execute checkOpened() for every element's interaction in order to check that element placed on the correct page
All JDI assertions are strict by default except verify()
All JDI assertions are soft. You need to call assertResults() method in order to throw failed assertions
Try to click on element even if it is partly overlapped
Click at the top-left corner of the element
Click at the top-right corner of the element
Click at the bottom-left corner of the element
Click at the bottom-right corner of the element
Use Selenium click at the center of the element
Use Selenium click at the center of the element
Click using Java Script
Smart Get text (try to get text from text, value and inner text of the element)
Get text of the element using Selenium getText() method
Get element's text from value attribute
Get element's text from innerText of the element
Get text for element by label tag associated with this element (by "for-id" attributes)
Text Field input as set value in to the "value" attribute
Text Field input using Selenium sendKeys(...) method
Text Field input clear field before do sendKeys
Use Sauce Labs capabilities to run tests remotely
Use Sauce Labs capabilities to run tests remotely
Use BrowserStack capabilities to run tests remotely
Use Selenium  to run tests remotely, driver.remote.url should be specified.
No JDI logs
Log unexpected errors only
Log critical errors and unexpected errors
Log errors and warnings
Log steps messages and errors
Log info and step messages as well as errors
Log almost all messages except trace
Log almost all messages including trace
Log all messages
Convert element's variable name to "kebab-case" ([smart.locator=[ui=%s] and public TextField userName] > [ui=user-name])
Convert element's variable name to "camelCase" ([smart.locator=[ui=%s] and public TextField userName] > [ui=userName])
Convert element's variable name to "snake_case" ([smart.locator=[ui=%s] and public TextField userName] > [ui=user-name])
Convert element's variable name to "PascalCase" ([smart.locator=[ui=%s] and public TextField userName] > [ui=UserName])
Convert element's variable name to "UPPER_SNAKE_CASE" ([smart.locator=[ui=%s] and public TextField userName] > [ui=USER_NAME])
Convert element's variable name to "First Upper Case" ([smart.locator=//*[text()='%s'] and public Button submitButton] > //*[text()='Submit Button'])
Convert element's variable name to "ALL UPPER CASE" ([smart.locator=//*[text()='%s'] and public Button submitButton] > //*[text()='SUBMIT BUTTON'])
Do not use smart search
Do not use smart search
Use smart search only if elements has @UI annotation
Use smart search if elements has @UI annotation or not a PageObjecct
Always use smart search
